Example

Turbo Generators plc manufacture seven large turbines for a customer. Three of these turbines do not meet the customer’s specification. Quality control inspectors choose two turbines at random. Let the discrete random variable \(X\) be defined to be the number of turbines inspected which meet the customer’s specification.

  1. Find the probabilities that \(X\) takes the values \(0, 1\) or \(2\)
  2. Find and graph the cumulative distribution function.

Solution

  1. The possible values of \(X\) are clearly \(0, 1\) or \(2\) and may occur as follows: \(\qquad\begin{matrix} \text{Sample Space}\qquad\qquad&\text{Value of}\ X\\ \text{Turbine faulty, Turbine faulty}\hfill&0\\ \text{Turbine faulty, Turbine good}\hfill&1\\ \text{Turbine good, Turbine faulty}\hfill&1\\ \text{Turbine good, Turbine good}\hfill&2 \end{matrix}\) \(\phantom{(a)\ }\)
    We can easily calculate the probability that \(X\) takes the values \(0,1\) or \(2\) as follows:
    \(\text{P}(X=0)=\dfrac{3}{7}\times\dfrac{2}{6}=\dfrac{1}{7}\)
    \(\text{P}(X=1)=\dfrac{4}{7}\times\dfrac{3}{6}+\dfrac{3}{7}\times\dfrac{4}{6}=\dfrac{4}{7}\)
    \(\text{P}(X=2)=\dfrac{4}{7}\times\dfrac{3}{6}=\dfrac{2}{7}\)
    The values of \(\displaystyle{F(x)=\sum_{x_i\le x}\text{P}(X=x_i)}\) are clearly \(F(0)=\dfrac{1}{7}\qquad F(1)=\frac{5}{7}\qquad\text{and}\qquad F(2)=\dfrac{7}{7}=1\)
